thread.title: Stay inside: UAE Consulate in Boston warns Emiratis
thread.title_full: Stay inside: UAE Consulate in Boston warns Emiratis

title: Stay inside: UAE Consulate in Boston warns Emiratis
text: (AP) Residents in the affected states are advised to stay indoors The UAE Consulate General in Boston has advised Emirati nationals to to stay indoors on Thursday, February 9th. The storm is expected to arrive at around 5AM in local time. In an Instagram post, the consulate showed the areas that are expected to be hit hard by the coming storm which is forecast to deliver a snow accumulation of 8 to 14 inches. A photo posted by UAE Consulate General Boston (@uaeinboston) on Feb 8, 2017 at 2:59pm PST Much of the northeastern U.S. is preparing for a winter storm that could bring a foot of snow or more to some areas. The storm is expected to hit eastern Pennsylvania and northern New Jersey with rain early Thursday morning, before changing over to snow in time for the morning commute. The National Weather Service predicted Boston and New York City would get 8 to 12 inches of snow and Philadelphia 6 to 8 inches. Near whiteout conditions are possible, with snow expected to fall at a clip of 2 to 4 inches per hour at the height of the storm. High winds, coastal flooding and power outages are also possible. Many communities across the region announced winter parking restrictions and school closures in advance of the storm. Share
